title: Southern Pecan Pie II
description: Experience the rich, buttery goodness of this classic Southern pecan pie, a timeless dessert that combines a flaky homemade crust with a luscious, sweet pecan filling. Perfectly golden and beautifully textured, this pie is sure to become a cherished favorite for family gatherings and special occasions.
ingredients: ½ cup butter, chilled and diced
instructions: In a large bowl, combine 1 ½ cups flour, 3 tablespoons sugar, and salt.
Cut in the chilled diced butter until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
Mix the egg yolk with ice water and stir into the flour mixture until it forms a ball.
Wrap the dough in plastic wrap and refrigerate for 1 hour or overnight.
Roll out the dough and place it into a 9-inch pie plate.
Place pecan halves evenly in the bottom of the pie crust.
In a large bowl, stir together ¾ cup sugar and 2 tablespoons flour.
Add eggs, corn syrup, milk, melted butter, and vanilla extract; blend well.
Pour the filling mixture over the pecans in the crust.
Bake in the preheated oven for 10 minutes.
Reduce oven temperature to 350°F (175°C) and bake for an additional 40 to 50 minutes, or until the pie is golden brown and the filling is set.
Allow the pie to cool completely before serving.
tips: For a flaky crust, keep the butter cold and handle the dough as little as possible. Avoid overbaking to prevent a dry filling; the pie is done when the center is just set but still slightly jiggly. Let the pie cool fully to allow the filling to firm up for clean slices.

structured_content.content: This Southern Pecan Pie II is a beautiful blend of buttery crust and rich, sweet pecan filling that melts in your mouth. Its golden top and glossy pecans invite you to indulge in a slice of Southern tradition that’s both comforting and elegant.

note.label: Why You'll Love This Recipe
note.content:
• Classic Southern dessert with authentic flavors
  • Flaky homemade crust paired with a luscious pecan filling
  • Perfect for holiday dinners, family gatherings, and celebrations
  • Uses simple pantry staples and fresh pecans for a natural sweetness
  • A timeless recipe passed down through generations

structured_content.content: I first tasted this pie at a family reunion, and its rich, nutty sweetness instantly reminded me of Southern hospitality and warm, joyful moments shared around the table. It’s a recipe that carries stories and love in every bite.

• Main ingredient: Fresh pecan halves provide a crunchy texture and deep nutty flavor essential for an authentic Southern pecan pie.
  • Key seasonings/flavoring agents: Vanilla extract enhances the sweetness and adds aromatic depth.
  • Supporting ingredients: Butter creates a flaky crust and adds richness to the filling; corn syrup gives the filling its signature glossy, smooth texture.
  • Equipment needed: Mixing bowls, pie plate, rolling pin, and oven for baking.

Preparation:
Combine dry ingredients and cut in cold butter until crumbly; mix egg yolk and ice water to form dough. Chill dough for at least 1 hour to relax gluten and ensure flakiness.
Cooking/Baking Process:
Roll out dough and fit into pie plate. Layer pecans evenly. Mix filling ingredients thoroughly and pour over pecans. Bake first at high heat to set crust, then lower temperature to cook filling evenly until golden and set.
Finishing Touches:
Cool pie completely to allow filling to firm up, making slicing easier. Serve with whipped cream or vanilla ice cream for an extra indulgence.

note.label: You Must Know
note.content:
• Preheat oven properly and start baking at 450°F to set the crust quickly.
  • Avoid overmixing the dough to keep it tender and flaky.
  • The filling is ready when it is golden brown and slightly jiggly in the center.
  • Store leftover pie covered at room temperature for up to 2 days or refrigerated for up to 4 days; reheat gently if desired.

structured_content.content: Sharing this pie with loved ones always brings a sense of warmth and nostalgia. It’s a dessert that sparks conversations and smiles, making every occasion feel special and memorable.

Enhance the pie by adding a pinch of cinnamon or a splash of bourbon to the filling for a warm, spicy twist. Toasting the pecans lightly before baking intensifies their flavor and adds a delightful crunch.
Serve warm or at room temperature with a dollop of whipped cream or a scoop of vanilla ice cream. Pair with a cup of strong coffee or a glass of dessert wine for a perfect finish to any meal.

For a gluten-free version, substitute the all-purpose flour in the crust with a gluten-free flour blend. Vegan adaptations can be made by using plant-based butter and egg replacers, while still maintaining the rich, nutty essence of the pie.

note.label: Pro Tips
note.content:
• Keep butter and water ice cold to ensure a flaky crust.
  • Use a pastry cutter or two knives to cut butter into flour for even crumbs.
  • Bake at high heat initially to set crust, then reduce temperature to avoid burning.
  • Brush crust edges with egg wash for a beautiful golden finish.

structured_content.content: With this Southern Pecan Pie II recipe, you’re not just baking a dessert—you’re creating a slice of Southern heritage that brings joy and comfort to your table. Enjoy the process and the delicious rewards!
